name: Size Does Matter GDL Game Jam
name_original: Size Does Matter GDL Game Jam
description:
I wanted to utilize this game jam as an opportunity to teach myself basic destructive physics, so I knew I wanted to include that in some aspect. While thinking of what to do after the theme was revealed - the theme being that size does matter - I thought it would be awesome to have a wrecking-ball like ability with a character who could destroy walls when huge. This also allowed me to explore the math behind spiderman-like traversal mechanics which was pretty fun.

Now that I knew the character could transfer between sizes (which is necessary for the progression of the game), I wanted to give the larger player a lot of weight which is expressed in both the sound design and animations. Of course I also knew that to balance the game, I wanted the player to be careful about when they chose to be big. I decided to include an "energy bar" of sorts that increases when you swing from things and decreases when you are big.

---------------------------------

Me - all the logic and programming, modeled, textured and animated the main character, created the level design, the ui, and all the gameplay
Not me - grass, trees, logs, dirt texture, sounds

I hope you have fun!

-----------------------------------

Controls

Move - WASD
Jump - Space
Grapple - Left Mouse
Toggle Size - Right Mouse
Sprint - Shift
